availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John K. Shackelford (Madisonville, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Madisonville, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Lincoln County, Kentucky, native. Married to Ellen Shackelford. Father of Eddie Shackelford, Laura Shackelford, Willie Shackelford, Robert Shackelford, and Charley Shackelford. Farmer in Madisonville in 1864. Private in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Regiment Cavalry from September 3, 1864 to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population/Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins, Madisonville, p. 13.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 405.
Find A Grave, "John K. Shackelford (April 15, 1829-August 17, 1898)," Memorial #63724947, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63724947 (accessed April 18, 2018).
